Player History
Signed as a free agent by San Francisco on 4/1/1985 to a minor league deal...
Injured on 8/12/1986 with a Broken Ribs, out for 8 weeks...
Had first career hit on 4/13/1987, off Roger Clemens (BOS)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/4/1987, off Lary Sorensen (SEA)...
Traded from Detroit to Seattle on 2/2/1988 (Going to SEA: P Greg Swindell, P Dennis Cook, P Colin Ward, C Mackey Sasser. Going to DET: P Greg Hibbard, 3B Gary Sheffield, 3B Jim Presley, LF Gorma
n Thomas, RF Tom Brunansky)...
2/2/1989: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,100,000 through salary arbitration...
2/2/1990: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,707,143 through salary arbitration...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against Toronto on 7/9/1990...
Won Gold Glove Award at Catcher in 1990...
2/2/1991: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,707,143 through salary arbitration...
4/11/1991: Signed a contract extension with Seattle, $1,370,000 per year, for 2 years.
Won Player of the Week award on 8/7/1992, hitting .474 with 3 HR, 9 RBI...
